Recommended Treatment: Observation (no adjuvant therapy) per NCCN guidelines for Stage IA, low-risk endometrioid endometrial carcinoma
Description: Surgical pathology of a total hysterectomy revealed a primary low-grade endometrioid adenocarcinoma confined to the endometrium with <10% myometrial invasion, no lymphovascular invasion, and negative lymph nodes (pT1a pN0, Stage IA). The fallopian tubes, cervix, and parametrial tissues are free of tumor.
Patient Notes: Your surgery removed a low-grade uterine cancer that was confined to the lining of the uterus without any spread to lymph nodes, which corresponds to an early stage (IA). Because this is a low-risk tumor, no further treatments like chemotherapy or radiation are required at this time. We will monitor you with regular check-ups to ensure your continued health.

verification.assessment: The extraction accurately reflects the key pathologic findings, staging, and guideline-based management. Minor details such as precise grade notation, tumor size, and formal margin statement were not included but do not alter the core accuracy.
